panels.description: Number of CIFS operations per second.

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (node_cifs_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(node_cifs_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources CIFS IOPs by Cluster

panels.description: Number of NFS operations per second.

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (node_nfs_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(node_nfs_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources NFS IOPs by Cluster

panels.description: Number of operations per second serviced by the volume.

targets.expr:
sum by (cluster) (volume_total_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, sum by (cluster) (avg_over_time(volume_total_ops{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Total IOPs by Cluster

panels.description: Average processor utilization across all processors in the system.

targets.expr:
avg by (cluster) (node_avg_processor_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, avg by (cluster) (avg_over_time(node_avg_processor_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Clusters by Average CPU Utilization

panels.description: System CPU resource utilization is a computed percentage that indicates how busy the system is based on a combination of the most heavily utilized domain and idle CPU cycles. This metric determines the amount of available CPU and will vary based on domains reaching their limits OR exhausting all idle CPU cycles, whichever comes first.

targets.expr:
avg by (cluster) (node_cpu_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, avg by (cluster) (avg_over_time(node_cpu_busy{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Clusters by CPU busy

panels.description: Average latency in microseconds for the WAFL filesystem to process all the operations on the volume; not including request processing or network communication time. node_volume_avg_latency is [volume_avg_latency](#volume_avg_latency) aggregated by `node`.

targets.expr:
avg by (cluster) (node_volume_avg_latency{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"})
and
topk($TopResources, avg by (cluster) (avg_over_time(node_volume_avg_latency{datacenter=~"$Datacenter",cluster=~"$Cluster"}[3h] @ end())))

panels.title: Top $TopResources Clusters by Average Latency

panels.description: Average latency in microseconds for the WAFL filesystem to process all the operations on the volume; not including request processing or network communication time.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Average Latency by SVMs

panels.description: Number of operations per second serviced by the volume.
panels.title: Top $TopResources IOPs by SVMs

panels.description: Average latency in microseconds for the WAFL filesystem to process all the operations on the volume; not including request processing or network communication time.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by Average Latency

panels.description: Number of operations per second serviced by the volume.
panels.title: Top $TopResources Volumes by IOPs
